ChildRecordsR 0.1.0

  • Reference

Openning a data file in childrecording class

Source: R/file_openner.R
file.openner.Rd

Open a csv file from a ChildRecordings class. The function provide transformation on data such as create a true segment_onset and segment_offset based on meta data. Will also provide POSIXct time info if strat_time of the recording is provided in the meta

file.openner(meta_row, ChildRecordings)

Arguments

meta_row

: a row from the meta containing all the info of the cvs file
ChildRecordings

: a ChildRecordings class

Value

A data.frame

Examples

library(ChildRecordsR)
path = "/mnt/94707AA4707A8CAC/CNRS/corpus/namibia-data/"
CR = ChildRecordings(path)

#> ###############################################
#> Hello Wellcome to the ChildRecordings R Project 
#> 
#> Your ChildRecording project path containe : 
#>  1720  annotations files 
#>  1720  are referenced in the metadata 
#>  5  coders were finded :  textgrid_m1 vtc textgrid_mm textgrid_ak textgrid_ac
#>  All files seems to be present and referenced in the metadata (good news ;) )
#> 
#>   379  metadata don't have a start recording time (a.k.a start.time) 
#> 	 therefore time indicators wil not be build for those files 
#> 	 more infos in ChildRecordings$integrity_test$missing.start.time 
#>   362  files are empty 
#> 	 This should normally mean that no annotation were provided by annotator 
#> 	 more infos in ChildRecordings$integrity_test$empty.files 
raw_file <- file.openner(CR$all.meta[1,],CR)
head(raw_file)
